page.title: 08EDUCATION IN BALFRON AREA
page.content: The children play football and netball and compete for local trophies with the other rural{primaries. Some pupils learn to play the recorder and take part in the Day of Recorders, while others learn modern or Scottish Country Dancing. The choir competes in the Falkirk Festival of Music each year and has won first prize on several occasions. The High School is a rural, fully- comprehensive{Secondary School}with 10 "feeder" schools. In this decade, when falling rolls are the general rule, Balfron High School is the exception, with about 750 pupils at present and an expected increase in the future. The original{school building}dates back to 1880's and the newest part was completed in 1982. Accommodation is still inadequate and the playground contains 16 temporary classrooms.
